verses.plain: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.

tokens.t: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal,
as unto babes in Christ.

verses.plain: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.

tokens.t: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able
, neither yet now are ye able.

verses.plain: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

tokens.t: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas
among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

verses.plain: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

tokens.t: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I
of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

verses.plain: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

tokens.t: Who then is Paul, and who
Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

verses.plain: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

tokens.t: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

verses.plain: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

tokens.t: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

verses.plain: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

tokens.t: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

verses.plain: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry, ye are God’s building.

tokens.t: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry,
God’s building.

verses.plain: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

tokens.t: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

verses.plain: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

tokens.t: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

verses.plain: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

tokens.t: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

verses.plain: Every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.

tokens.t: Every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.

verses.plain: If any man’s work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

tokens.t: If any man’s work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

verses.plain: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

tokens.t: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

verses.plain: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

tokens.t: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and
the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

verses.plain: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which temple ye are.

tokens.t: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which
ye are.

verses.plain: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

tokens.t: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

verses.plain: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

tokens.t: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

verses.plain: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

tokens.t: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

verses.plain: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;

tokens.t: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;

verses.plain: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

tokens.t: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

verses.plain: And ye are Christ’s; and Christ is God’s.

tokens.t: And ye are Christ’s; and Christ
God’s.
